newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil drifts amid jitters over IPE squeeze.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil drifts amid jitters over IPE squeeze.

text.p: NWE gas oil premiums were talked unchanged to slightly easier on Monday but demand slackened as jittery traders sought to guard against potential price volatility resulting from a squeeze on the Nov IPE expiry.
Benchmark IPE finished down $2 at $218.75 per tonne for the Dec contract in thin trade amid uncertainty over the outcome of the record high 865,100 tonne delivery on the Nov contract.
Barge dealers complained barges were queuing to take delivery of the IPE delivery but some traders disputed that, saying loading later on Monday was almost normal.

A cargo of low sulphur diesel (-7/-22) traded at Dec IPE +$15 into Rostock for late November, equivalent to +$16 into Hamburg, around unchanged. A barge of refinery grade heating oil was done at Dec +$2.50 for early December, also unchanged.
A cargo of French heating oil was offered slightly easier at Dec IPE +$6.50/7 and bid at +$5/6 into Le Havre. German was offered at Dec IPE +$6 and bid at +$4 for late November.

Large Russian cargoes were offered at formula +$2.50 and bid at evens. Heating oil barges were offered at Dec IPE +$1.75/$2 for storage material and +$3.50, $4 and $4.50 for refinery grade for end November. -- William Maclean, London +44 171 542 7646
